item.title: 律师事务所霍金路伟与凯威莱德计划合并，成立拥有 3100 名律师的事务所
item.description: 全球律师事务所霍金路伟（Hogan Lovells）和总部位于纽约的凯威莱德律师事务所（Cadwalader, Wickersham & Taft）周四表示，两家公司已同意合并，从而创建一家拥有 3100 名律师、年收入合计 36 亿美元的大型事务所。【原文：Global law firm Hogan Lovells and New York-based Cadwalader, Wickersham & Taft have agreed to merge, the firms said on Thursday, creating a mega-firm with 3,100 lawyers and a combined $3.6 billion in annual revenue.】

item.title: 星链（Starlink）称与一颗卫星失去通信
item.description: SpaceX的Starlink称，周三35956号卫星出现异常，导致在418千米（259.73英里）处与飞行器失去通信。【原文：SpaceX's Starlink said it experienced an anomaly on satellite 35956 on Wednesday, which led to a loss of communications with the vehicle at 418 km (259.73 miles).】

item.title: 卡尼淡化加美在关键领域达成贸易协议的可能性
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）周四表示，计划与美国在关键领域达成贸易协议的可能性不大，并称这一问题将在明年计划对美国-加拿大-墨西哥贸易协定进行的审查中涉及。【原文：Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney on Thursday said a planned trade deal with the United States on key sectors was unlikely, saying the issue would be covered in a planned review of the United States-Canada-Mexico trade pact next year.】

item.title: 解说员：特朗普媒体梦寐以求的聚变能源是什么？
item.description: 数十年来，科学家和公司一直在努力利用聚变能（即太阳燃烧的过程）为地球发电。【原文：Scientists and companies have been trying for decades to harness fusion energy, the process that fires the sun, to generate electricity on Earth.】

item.title: 报告称，2025 年医疗保险参保人购买某些药物的费用将减少 50
item.description: 在美国人口最多的五个州进行的一项研究表明，参加医疗保险的美国人在2026年自费购买一些药物的费用将减少约50%，这些药物包括辉瑞公司和百时美施贵宝公司的血液稀释剂Eliquis以及默克公司的糖尿病药物Januvia。【原文：Americans enrolled in Medicare will pay about 50% less out of pocket in 2026 for some drugs including Pfizer and Bristol Myers Squibb's blood thinner Eliquis and Merck & Co's diabetes drug Januvia, a study in the five most populous U.S. states suggested.】

item.title: 特朗普声称他削减了能源成本。他做到了吗？
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在周三晚的白宫演讲中将降低汽油价格、增加发电量和促进煤炭行业发展归功于自己。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump took credit during his White House speech on Wednesday night for reducing gasoline prices, increasing power generation, and boosting the coal industry.】

item.title: 保诚在领导层大调整中将主要部门置于首席执行官沙利文领导之下
item.description: 保德信金融公司将一些重要部门的负责人置于首席执行官安德鲁-沙利文（Andrew Sullivan）的直接监督之下，并任命公司资深人士菲尔-瓦尔德克（Phil Waldeck）担任美国业务主管，这是这家多元化金融服务公司最大的改革之一。【原文：Prudential Financial has placed the heads of some key units under the direct supervision of CEO Andrew Sullivan and appointed company veteran Phil Waldeck as the head of its U.S. businesses, in one of the biggest overhauls at the diversified financial services firm.】

item.title: 人工智能编码需求激增，Lovable 在最新一轮融资中估值达 66 亿美元
item.description: 人工智能软件开发初创公司 Lovable 周四表示，该公司在一轮早期融资中筹集了 3.3 亿美元，对这家总部位于斯德哥尔摩的公司的估值为 66 亿美元。【原文：AI software development startup Lovable said on Thursday it raised $330 million in an early-stage funding round that values the Stockholm-based company at $6.6 billion.】

item.title: 立法者对 Echostar 向 AT&T 和 SpaceX 出售无线频谱的交易表示担忧
item.description: 两位民主党议员周四对 EchoStar 以 400 亿美元向 AT&T 和 SpaceX 出售关键频谱的交易表示担忧，称这可能会削弱无线和卫星市场的竞争。【原文：Two Democratic lawmakers on Thursday raised concerns about EchoStar's deals to sell key spectrum to AT&T and SpaceX for $40 billion, saying it could shrink competition in wireless and satellite markets.】

item.title: 宏碁、华硕和海信在与诺基亚的视频流专利纠纷案中赢得英国法院裁决
item.description: 台湾科技公司宏碁（Acer）、华硕（Asus）和中国海信（Hisense）周四在与诺基亚（Nokia）关于视频编码技术的全球专利纠纷中赢得了伦敦高等法院的裁决。【原文：Taiwanese tech companies Acer and Asus and China-based Hisense won a ruling from London's High Court on Thursday in their global patent dispute with Nokia over video coding technology.】

item.title: Ouraring 投诉后，美国国际贸易委员会将调查某些可穿戴设备
item.description: 美国国际贸易委员会（U.S. International Trade Commission）周四在一份声明中表示，在Ouraring Inc提出投诉后，该委员会正在对某些可穿戴设备展开调查。【原文：The U.S. International Trade Commission is launching an investigation into certain wearable devices after Ouraring Inc filed a complaint, it said in a statement on Thursday.】

item.title: 白宫顾问哈塞特称赞通胀数据低于预期
item.description: 白宫经济顾问凯文-哈塞特（Kevin Hassett）周四对消费者物价指数报告表示欢迎，称美国经济正呈现出高增长和低通胀的态势。【原文：White House economic adviser Kevin Hassett welcomed the consumer price index report on Thursday, saying the U.S. economy was showing high growth and lower inflation.】

item.title: 奥地利最高法院裁定 Meta 的广告模式非法，并下令全面改革欧盟的用户数据处理方法
item.description: 奥地利最高法院裁定，Meta 公司的个性化广告模式是非法的，并命令该公司在收到任何请求的 14 天内，向欧盟各国的用户提供对其个人数据的完全访问权限，这是一项可直接执行的终审判决，为整个欧盟树立了具有约束力的法律先例。【原文：Austria's Supreme Court has ruled that Meta's personalized advertising model is unlawful and ordered the company to provide users across the European Union with complete access to their personal data within 14 days of any request, in a final and directly enforceable decision that sets a binding legal precedent across the bloc.】

item.title: 在特朗普可能下令放宽大麻限制之前，大麻股上涨
item.description: 受美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将签署行政命令放宽对大麻的联邦监管的预期推动，大麻公司的股票在周四的盘前交易中上涨。【原文：Shares of cannabis firms rose in premarket trading on Thursday, driven by expectations that U.S. President Donald Trump will sign an executive order easing federal regulations on marijuana.】

item.title: VIEW 美国 11 月消费者价格增幅低于预期
item.description: 截至 11 月份的一年中，美国消费者物价涨幅低于预期，由于受到政府长期停摆的影响，美联储 1 月份降息的预期略有上升。【原文：U.S. consumer prices rose less than expected in the year to November, and expectations for a January rate cut from the Federal Reserve inched up slightly as the report was impacted by the extended government shutdown.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数下降，季节性波动持续存在
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数有所下降，扭转了前一周激增的趋势，表明 12 月份劳动力市场状况保持稳定。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits fell last week, reversing the prior week's surge and suggesting labor market conditions remained stable in December.】

item.title: 美国 11 月年度消费者价格增幅低于预期
item.description: 截至 11 月的一年中，美国消费者价格增幅低于预期，但这种放缓可能是技术性的，美国人仍然面临着负担能力方面的挑战，而这些挑战部分归咎于进口关税。【原文：U.S. consumer prices increased less than expected in the year to November, but the moderation is likely technical and Americans continued to face affordability challenges that have been partly blamed on tariffs on imports.】

item.title: 二手车市场疲软导致 CarMax 季度利润和收入下滑
item.description: 受美国二手车需求疲软和价格下跌的影响，CarMax 周四公布了第三季度收入和利润下降的报告。【原文：CarMax reported a drop in third-quarter revenue and profit on Thursday, hurt by weaker demand for and falling prices of used vehicles in the U.S.】

item.title: Tradeweb 首席执行官称全天候交易将成为主流
item.description: Tradeweb 首席执行官在周四发表的一封信中写道，"毫无疑问"，全天候交易将成为整个市场的常态，并强调了这一理念在整个华尔街获得追捧的速度。【原文：There is "no doubt" that round-the-clock trading will be the norm across markets, Tradeweb's Chief Executive Officer wrote in a letter published on Thursday, highlighting the pace at which the idea is gaining traction across Wall Street.】

item.title: 大科技支持的联盟支持生物垃圾碳清除公司
item.description: 一个由谷歌和 Stripe 等大科技公司支持的联盟已同意支付 4420 万美元，购买一家加拿大公司的碳信用额度，该公司旨在从生物垃圾中清除二氧化碳。【原文：A coalition backed by Big Tech companies including Google and Stripe has agreed to pay $44.2 million for carbon credits from a Canadian company that aims to remove carbon dioxide from biowaste, the coalition's head of deployment told Reuters.】

item.title: 英国央行在紧张投票后下调利率，但对进一步行动表示谨慎
item.description: 英国央行周四在政策制定者以微弱票数通过后下调了利率，但这也表明，已经在逐步降低借贷成本的步伐可能会进一步放缓。【原文：The Bank of England cut interest rates on Thursday after a narrow vote by policymakers, but it signalled that the already gradual pace of lowering borrowing costs might slow further.】

item.title: 领导层变动前，Lululemon 因 Elliott 下注 10 亿美元而大涨
item.description: Lululemon Athletica 股价在周四的盘前交易中上涨了近 8%，此前有报道称 Elliott Management 公司已在这家运动休闲服制造商中建立了 10 亿美元的股份，并正在与前 Ralph Lauren 高管 Jane Nielsen 合作，希望她能担任首席执行官一职。【原文：Lululemon Athletica shares rose nearly 8% in premarket trading on Thursday after reports Elliott Management has built a $1 billion stake in the athleisure wear maker and is working with former Ralph Lauren executive Jane Nielsen for a potential CEO role.】

item.title: 金融数据公司 FactSet 季度利润攀升，订阅量稳步增长
item.description: 金融数据公司 FactSet 周四公布，由于对其金融数据和分析产品的需求增加，第一季度利润有所增长。【原文：Financial data firm FactSet posted a rise in first-quarter profit on Thursday, driven by increased demand for its financial data and analytics offerings.】

item.title: 伍德赛德公司下任首席执行官必须引导成本高昂的液化天然气项目渡过供应过剩的风险
item.description: 伍德赛德能源公司（Woodside Energy）在首席执行官梅格-奥尼尔（Meg O'Neill）出人意料地离开公司前往英国石油公司（BP）担任高管后，面临着领导层的调整。【原文：Woodside Energy faces a leadership shake-up after chief executive Meg O'Neill's surprise exit for the top job at BP , a move that comes as the Australian firm is striving to deliver key projects in a market braced for oversupply.】

item.title: Zara 借助人工智能，利用真人模特生成时尚图像
item.description: Zara 已成为最新一家使用人工智能来帮助创建穿着不同服装的真实模特新图像的快速时尚零售商，从而加快了生产流程，这是可能对时尚摄影产生重大影响的行业转变的一部分。【原文：Zara has become the latest fast-fashion retailer to use AI to help create new images of real models in different outfits, speeding up the production process as part of an industry shift that could have a major impact on fashion photography.】

item.title: Moderna 获得全球联盟高达 5430 万美元的禽流感疫苗资助
item.description: 美国制药商Moderna公司周四表示，该公司将从一个全球联盟获得高达5430万美元的资助，以支持其实验性禽流感疫苗的后期开发。【原文：Moderna will get up to $54.3 million in funding from a global coalition to support late-stage development of its experimental bird flu vaccine, the U.S. drugmaker said on Thursday.】

item.title: 英国央行在紧张投票后降低利率，但对进一步降息发出谨慎信号
item.description: 伦敦，12 月 18 日（路透社）--英国央行在决策者以微弱票数通过投票后于周四下调了利率，但这表明，已经在逐步降低借贷成本的步伐可能会进一步放缓。【原文：LONDON, Dec 18 (Reuters) - The Bank of England cut interest rates on Thursday after a narrow vote by policymakers but it signalled that the already gradual pace of lowering borrowing costs might slow further.】

item.title: 纳斯达克预计未来一年将有更多金额超过 10 亿美元的 IPO 上市
item.description: 纳斯达克的一位高层管理人员告诉路透社，受几家大型初创企业在未来几个月内进军美国资本市场的推动，纳斯达克预计明年的首次公开募股将出现跳跃式增长。【原文：Nasdaq expects a jump in initial public offerings next year driven by several large startups aiming to tap U.S. capital markets in coming months, a top company executive told Reuters.】

item.title: 大众汽车推进德国成本削减，品牌负责人表示
item.description: 德国大众汽车公司核心品牌负责人周四在接受媒体采访时表示，该公司的成本削减工作正在取得进展，并提到了该集团在德国工厂的裁员和节支情况。【原文：Volkswagen is making progress with its cost-cutting drive, the head of the German carmaker's core brands said in a media interview on Thursday, pointing to headcount reductions and savings at the group's plants in Germany.】

item.title: 上午竞标：光学与神谕
item.description: 投资者今天最关注的是延迟发布的、略显不同寻常的美国消费者物价通胀报告，该报告将成为美联储明年是否可能继续降息的重要标志。【原文：Investors' top focus today is the delayed - and slightly unusual - U.S. consumer price inflation report, which will be an important marker for whether the Federal Reserve is likely to keep cutting interest rates next year.】
